repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: Wouldn't it be better to normalize the markdown lines in `convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines` ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -476,15 +476,17 @@ function M.signature_help(_, result, ctx, config)
     vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'signatureHelpProvider', 'triggerCharacters')
   local ft = vim.bo[ctx.bufnr].filetype
   local lines, hl = util.convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines(result, ft, triggers)
-  if vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then
+  if not lines or vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then

comment_data.body: Not sure I understand what you mean by "normalize".
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -476,15 +476,17 @@ function M.signature_help(_, result, ctx, config)
     vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'signatureHelpProvider', 'triggerCharacters')
   local ft = vim.bo[ctx.bufnr].filetype
   local lines, hl = util.convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines(result, ft, triggers)
-  if vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then
+  if not lines or vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then

comment_data.body:
I mean: make the return of `convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines` always return the signature in the first line, without ```` ``` ````s.
That function naming looks like a good candidate for that behavior

(note that I'm an outsider here, I don't have much knowledge on this part of the code, I'm just curious why you made a check after a conversion function instead of changing the conversion function to always return the same format of output)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -476,15 +476,17 @@ function M.signature_help(_, result, ctx, config)
     vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'signatureHelpProvider', 'triggerCharacters')
   local ft = vim.bo[ctx.bufnr].filetype
   local lines, hl = util.convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines(result, ft, triggers)
-  if vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then
+  if not lines or vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then

comment_data.body: `convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines` converts the input text to Markdown content. Given that we want to display the signature with the Treesitter highlights of the respective language and we use the Markdown parser for these floating windows, the code block is necessary.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -476,15 +476,17 @@ function M.signature_help(_, result, ctx, config)
     vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'signatureHelpProvider', 'triggerCharacters')
   local ft = vim.bo[ctx.bufnr].filetype
   local lines, hl = util.convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines(result, ft, triggers)
-  if vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then
+  if not lines or vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then

comment_data.body: The reason why this is conditional is because LSP Markdown content could also be `plaintext`, and in such case we don't add any Markdown decorations and display the content as is.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -476,15 +476,17 @@ function M.signature_help(_, result, ctx, config)
     vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'signatureHelpProvider', 'triggerCharacters')
   local ft = vim.bo[ctx.bufnr].filetype
   local lines, hl = util.convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines(result, ft, triggers)
-  if vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then
+  if not lines or vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then

comment_data.body:
Make sense, thanks 👍
(note: I can't mark my own discussion as resolved)
comment_data.diff_hunk:

     vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'signatureHelpProvider', 'triggerCharacters')
   local ft = vim.bo[ctx.bufnr].filetype
   local lines, hl = util.convert_signature_help_to_markdown_lines(result, ft, triggers)
-  if vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then
+  if not lines or vim.tbl_isempty(lines) then

comment_data.body: It's okay! I appreciate your input and please ask all the questions you want :)
